intro: Dissotis caloneura var. setosior, commonly known as the hairy dissotis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale blue or white flowers, which bloom during the wet season. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
